subject: Web3
title: OneCoin: The Crypto Ponzi Scheme
description: A quick win: understand OneCoin: The Crypto Ponzi Scheme.

hook.text: OneCoin raised $4 billion from investors worldwide. The only problem: the cryptocurrency never actually existed.

buildup.text: Dr. Ruja Ignatova, the 'Crypto Queen,' traveled the world pitching OneCoin at lavish events to massive crowds.

discovery.text: OneCoin had no blockchain, no mining, and no real technology. It was a multi-level marketing scam with a crypto label.

twist.text: In 2017, Ignatova boarded a flight and disappeared. She is now on the FBI's most wanted list.

climax.text: Her brother was convicted and sentenced to 20 years. Ignatova has never been found.

punchline.text: $4 billion stolen for a cryptocurrency that never existed.

quiz.question: What was unique about the OneCoin scam?
options: The cryptocurrency never actually had a blockchain
